metadata.title: CVE-2024-40951 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ocfs2: fix NULL pointer dereference in ocfs2_abort_trigger()bdev->bd_super has been removed and commit 8887b94d9322 change the usagefrom bdev->bd_super to b_assoc_map->host->i_sb.  Since ocfs2 hasn't setbh->b_assoc_map, it will trigger NULL pointer dereference when callinginto ocfs2_abort_trigger().Actually this was pointed out in history, see commit 74e364ad1b13.  ButI've made a mistake when reviewing commit 8887b94d9322 and thenre-introduce this regression.Since we cannot revive bdev in buffer head, so fix this issue byinitializing all types of ocfs2 triggers when fill super, and then get thespecific ocfs2 trigger from ocfs2_caching_info when access journal.[joseph.qi@linux.alibaba.com: v2]  Link:https://lkml.kernel.org/r/20240602112045.1112708-1-joseph.qi@linux.alibaba.com

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-40951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
